title: posit<n, es>
description: a posit "n" bits long with "es" bits for the exponent

title: es
description: The maximum number of bits of the exponent.

title: sign
description: The sign of the number. If it is 1 the number is negative and 2's complement has to be done to decode the rest of the fields.

title: regime
description: The second field of the regime. It is of variable length and it is composed of a sequence of equal bits followed by one opposite bit.  It represents the total exponent along e.

title: exponent
description: The exponent that the nubmer is raised to in binary. It is obtained combining the regime and e following the formula: useed^k * 2^e

title: e
description: The third field of the regime. It represents the total exponent along the regime.

title: fraction
description: The last field of the number. It represents the fractional part of the number's value.

title: useed
description: The scaling factor of the regime. Its value equals 2^(2^es).

title: m
description: The length of the regime in bits. The opposite bit is not counted.

title: k
description: The exponent that scales the useed. It is obtained from the regime: If it is all 1s its value is m-1; if it is all 0s its value is -m.
